Lassa virus (LASV) is endemic in western africa. the first cellular receptor for arenavirus to be identified was -dystroglycan (DG), a ubiquitous receptor for extracellular matrix proteins (6). DG is a binding receptor for Old World arenaviruses, such as LASV and lymphocytic choriomeningitis virus (LCMV), and some of the clade C new world arenaviruses (7). a number of additional receptor candidates have recently been reported. type virus systems based on vesicular stomatitis virus (VSV) or lentivirus and retrovirus have also been established to examine viral entry mechanisms and to
